1.content:
Nick was randomly playing Final Fantasy XII on his PlayStation when the screen suddenly went blank. Such a shame - he had just been about to deal the final blow to Zeromus, which was a horribly difficult boss battle. He checked the back of the TV for any connection problems, and also checked the TV itself. Strange - it should have been on and functioning perfectly. Then the TV screen lit up and out came a bright light, which attached itself to Nick's wrist and formed into a watch-like device.

Nick checked the device for an inbuilt user's manual, only taking a few seconds to learn how to navigate the device. Once he found one, he stared.

"Transform into fictional girls? That's crazy," he said, then he remembered a line from "Sora no Otoshimono": "A theory of reality is unable to explain unrealistic events." "This deserves a test," he decided.

That was all well and good, but what would he test it on? And meanwhile, his PS2 had quietly shut itself off, not saving the data...
1.title: Da Capo (From the Top)

choices: The changes happen immediately and quickly.
11111.content:
Human Form: http://fc07.deviantart.net/fs71/f/2009/3...

Esper Form: http://media.giantbomb.com/uploads/1/153...

Nick retrieved his DS and his GameBoy Advance game "Final Fantasy VI Advance" game, started one up using the other, and scanned Terra. It took him a few tries, because he was so nervous that his hand was shaking. He navigated the watch's mainframe with an inexperienced hand, selecting himself as the target and pressing the "Execute" button.

He calmed down and waited for the changes, knowing that he wasn't going to wait long...
11111.title: Terra Branford

111111.content:
Nick's body immediately registered pain (albeit through the haze of what could only be likened to novocain) as his body stretched and contracted against itself. His sex inverted, he developed twin mounds on his chest, and his very skeletal structure changed. (It should be noted that women have three holes "down there", not two. One for fecal matter, one for urinal waste, and one for reproduction.)

After his body changed, next came the clothes. They twisted around him (her?) in a similar fashion, changing color and material, until she was left with a red halter top with matching forearm-length gloves and night-blue tights, with a silver cape.

So, since it obviously worked, what to do...?
111111.title: The changes happen immediately and quickly.

choices: Hang the attention and just go to Amelia's.
No, there has to be a way to remain inconspicuous...
1111111.content:
Nick knew who would like this - his friend Amelia. She had feelings for him, and he knew it, but that was her business until she confessed. Anyway, Nick had no idea how to go on a date, or really anything about romance. He didn't even know if he liked her back. The one time he tried to dig up feelings for her, he ended up getting extremely confused, yanking himself back to reality, watching Linkin Park OMVs on YouTube and crying about it, and finally falling asleep (still crying) despite it being six in the afternoon. His favorite one was this one: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FtnGjBlww...

Since then, Nick had tried to distance himself from Amelia, but she had found ways of getting his company. In any case, he felt bad about avoiding her for so long, but the prospect of going to her house made him feel excited and afraid all at once.

Then he hit upon a different problem: his clothes. No one in his family had anything in Terra's size, and her regular duds looked like a cosplay outfit. Should he go out as he was, or figure out some way to go that would allow him to remain unseen?
1111111.title: Decisions, decisions...

11111112.content:
Nick figured that if he was Terra, then he would have access to all of Terra's spells. So the question was, whether Terra had the "Teleport" or "Vanish" spells. The answer could easily be no, since Terra had to learn them both from magicite, but it was worth a shot.

Nick tried to remember what the characters from Final Fantasy VI did to cast spells. Sadly, he arrived at the inescapable conclusion that there was nothing to remember. All they showed was the character's hands and mouth moving, and then the spell being cast. However, he did also imagine a random image of him doing what could be described as virtually the same thing.

"What the heck?" Nick muttered. He duplicated the motions, and arrived in front of Amelia's house a second later.

Bottom line: it worked.
11111112.title: Teleport Spell!?

choices: "John smith," you say sarcastically. "No, I'm Nick."
111111121.content:
Nick raised a fist to knock on the door.

Time passed.

It wasn't that Nick was deliberately procrastinating, or that he had a logical reason for not wanting to see Amelia. He didn't understand it himself. He just didn't want to see Amelia for some reason. Seeing her made his heart pound, and his face heat up like he was developing a fever. He didn't know why; he had gone to a hospital in his spare time to ask about "personal-proximity-reactive colds" and described his conditions, and the doctor had burst out laughing and told him "good luck with her".

Nick decided it was a better idea not to think about knocking.

Fist to the door. Jerk fist forward via wrist repeatedly in such a way that it hits the door.

"Coming!" came Amelia's voice from the inside. It took an effort of will for Nick to keep himself on the doorstep.

After what seemed an eternity and that Nick therefore had to remind himself was only a few seconds, Amelia opened the door, said "We don't want any", closed the door, and opened it again immediately with an incredulous expression on her face.

She recognized Terra, that much Nick could tell. She was also extremely unnerved. She did a brilliant job of hiding it, however, as she said, "Who are you?"
111111121.title: Amelia's Gambit

1111111211.content:
Nick's heart started beating at what Nick clocked accurately at eighty miles per hour - well above any speed limit, and well below the accepted Nascar speed.

"Well?" Amelia asked. "Who are you?" She noticed the blush heating Nick's cheeks and added, "Is this a confession?"

Nick blushed some more, for no appreciable reason that he could identify. He found himself quoting "The Disappearance of Haruhi Suzumiya" and introducing himself as John Smith.

Amelia's brow furrowed. "Are you an idiot?" she asked.

"No," Nick said. "But my name isn't John Smith, it's Nick."

"You are an idiot!" Amelia said. She closed the door - or tried to, but Nick put his foot in the gap just in time.

"All right, you give me a name," Nick said. Inwardly, he screamed "What are you doing!" at himself, but he resolutely ignored it.

"How about Nicky?" Amelia suggested.
1111111211.title: Cosplay

11111112111.content:
“Nicky won’t work,” Nick said sourly. “Despite all appearances, I’m a man.”

Amelia took one look at Nick’s face, and checked his body, and said, “Can’t be.”

“Excuse me?” Nick asked.

“My friend Nick,” Amelia said, but then blushed. “My friend Nick, whom I happen to know has an enormous crush on me – not that he’s told me,” she admitted. “It’s just that it’s completely obvious by his behavior that he has feelings for me. But anyway,” she added, “Nick taught me how to tell when someone’s cross-dressing, and you don’t fit the bill. Sorry, but you’re a girl through and through.”

“I what?” Nick asked, meaning that Amelia had said that he had a crush on her.

“You’re a real girl,” Amelia said. “That’s what I said.”

Nick realized too late just how close he had come to being found out. The more rational part of his brain pointed out that he wasn’t trying to hide anything to begin with. “Ah, yeah, I knew that,” Nick said, trying pathetically to patch up the conversation. “So, you’re straight?”

“Straight?” Amelia said, confused. “So this is a confession!”

“Putting that aside,” Nick said hastily, wondering why he was even doing this, “About this ‘Nick’ person. You say he likes you, which means he’s confessed?”

“He hasn’t confessed,” Amelia admitted. “But it’s obvious.”

“Then, do you like him back?”

Amelia was silent for a moment. “I don’t know,” she said. “I have no experience with romance. I did try to dig up feelings for him, but I ended up getting confused, watching the Breaking the Habit Official Music Video on YouTube, and then crying myself to sleep at seven… why am I telling you this again?”

This was so similar to what happened to Nick that he started crying. Acting completely on his emotions, he embraced Amelia (against her will) and they both went toppling to the floor. He knew that Amelia had feelings for him, but hadn’t known that he had feelings for her back – intense feelings. And Amelia was the same way. Their reactions to each other were so similar it was farcical!

“Hey, what are you…” Amelia slapped Nick across the face. This woke him up.

“I… did I just…” Nick looked at his hands in amazement.

“Look, get out!” Amelia said.

“Hold on,” Nick said, figuring this was his best bet. “Look.” He started fiddling with the watch, and turned himself back to normal.

Amelia stared in amazement into his face, then in outrage, then in embarrassment. “You… you’re…”

“I told you my name was Nick,” Nick said. “And that I’m a man.”
11111112111.title: Nick's Realization

choices: Leave her alone to sort out her feelings.
111111121111.content:
Amelia fainted dead into Nick's arms. This was a source of brief excitement, but Nick snapped himself back to reality. Amelia had fainted, Nick had better carry her to her room or something. He picked her up, noting that she was lighter than expected, probably due to all the diet food she ate due to living in a Weight Watchers household, and carried her up the stairs to the second floor. He entered her room (at least he thought it was her room; he hadn't been here in a while after all), lay her down on the bed, and resolved to wait for her to wake up.

This meant that he had time to think and deal with his newly identified feelings. He loved Amelia; that much he knew for certain. All of his past irrational actions related to Amelia suddenly became clearer. He had distanced himself from her so as to avoid dealing with his own feelings, something he never thought he'd do.

About five minutes later, Amelia woke up. "Uhhh... my head..." she groaned, and Nick guiltily remembered that he'd accidentally bonked her head against the wall in the hallway. Then her eyes fell on Nick and widened. "What are you doing in my room?!" she said.

"Waiting," Nick said. "For you to wake up, anyway. I greeted you at the door, you fainted, and I carried you in here."

"You greeted me at the door?" Amelia asked, thinking back. "Wait... that's what happened. So tell me, how did you turn into Terra?"

Nick was pretty shocked. Amelia had accepted that he had turned into Terra. "Well..." He related the day's events.

Amelia listened with a rapt expression on her face. "Wow," she said. "Talk about lucky for you."

"I suppose," Nick said. "Incidentally, about what we talked about at the door..."

“What we talked about…?” Amelia asked, tilting her head. Then she blushed. “Oh, you heard about how I knew you loved me!”

“Uh-huh,” Nick nodded. “Truth be told, your circumstances for the Linkin Park video were exactly the same as mine.”

Amelia blinked. “Huh? You mean…”

Nick nodded. “You knew I liked you, but when you tried to dig up feelings for me, you ended up avoiding it by watching a Linkin Park OMV and crying yourself to sleep early. Well, I made the same observation about you, but when I tried to dig up return feelings, I also ended up watching a Linkin Park OMV and crying myself to sleep early.”

Amelia’s expression turned surprised and kind of disgusted. “You mean…”

Nick nodded. “We’re crazy about each other,” he said.

Amelia turned red, then redder, then still more red, then red some more. She flopped back down on her bed and started crying.
111111121111.title: Awakening

1111111211112.content:
From what he knew about psychology, Nick figured it was probably a better idea to leave the room and let her sort out her own feelings. He exited, closed the door, and entered the living room.

Come to think of it, why had he just calmly accepted that he liked Amelia like that? Maybe for the same reason that Amelia had calmly accepted that he had turned into Terra. Not that he knew why she did that, either.

Analyzing his own mental state, Nick figured that he and Amelia had a subliminal understanding of each other. They unconsciously sent thoughts along the equivalent of an internal telephone line, and that was how they managed to read each other.

Anyone who understood psychology as well as Nick would realize that the above explanation is complete and utter hooey.

Nick realized that he wasn't in the best mental state for judging things logically, and hadn't been since he had gotten the device. He also realized that Amelia must have been in a similar mental state when she accepted that he had turned into Terra. Therefore, the best thing for both of them was time away from the other in a calm setting.

No sooner did he have that thought than Amelia came down the stairs. "Hey, Nick," she said.

"Hey, Amelia," Nick said.

"Turn me into Terra?" Amelia asked.
1111111211112.title: A Sudden Request

11111112111121.content:
"Turn you into Terra?" Nick asked. "Okay, but why?"

"Why?" Amelia snorted. "Why not? She's mysterious, beautiful, powerful... she's the first female lead for the Final Fantasy series to be developed so well!"

"Okay..." Nick said. "By the way, according to this thing's inbuilt instruction manual, I can scan your form too. Do you want me to?"

Amelia gave Nick a confused look. "Why would I want to do that?"

"As a sort of failsafe," Nick explained. "There's a function on the watch that allows me to save your current guise as the norm, but it deletes the regular norm."

"Meaning...?"

"Meaning you could look like Terra for the rest of your life, and no one will question it or realize anything's wrong."

Amelia was silent for a moment.

"Okay," she said finally. "I...
11111112111121.title: Amelia's Choice

111111121111211.content:
"Okay," Nick says. "Gimme a moment..." He looked in the instructions. "Okay, give me your hand please."

"Okay...?" Amelia said uncertainly, reaching out to Nick with her right hand.

Nick took her hand, paused for a moment as his heartbeat skipped a beat, and placed it on the watch. Then he pressed the "Scan" button. Amelia's hand was lit up with a piercing light as her data was scanned, and then... nothing.

Amelia cautiously removed her hand from the device, and Nick checked the database. "Okay, you're in. I can do the rest myself." He targeted Amelia, selected Terra as the transformation, and… wait. "Oh, Amelia."

"Yeah?" Amelia asked.

"Are you particularly fond of the clothes you’re wearing?”

“I am, why?” Amelia asked.

“Because if you don’t take them off, they’ll be lost.”

Both Nick and Amelia realized the suggestiveness of Nick’s words at the exact same time. They engaged in an unconscious competition over who could blush redder in the same span of time, and there was no clear winner.

“Um,” Nick and Amelia said to each other at exactly the same time, and then followed up by saying “you first” in similar unison.

“No,” Nick said abruptly, after a few dozen seconds of silence. “Me first. I didn’t mean anything by that, I mean, I wasn’t trying to get you out of your clothes. I mean, it’s not that I don’t want to see you naked. It’s just that I have no intention of, well, you see…”

“Not without my permission, right?” Amelia suggested.

“Exactly. I wouldn’t get you naked without your permission,” Nick said, relieved.

“I trust you,” Amelia responded. “Is it okay if I change into some of my older, worn-out clothes?”

“Go ahead,” Nick said.


Amelia chose a too-small tank top and a pair of shredded jeans too small for her. Nick tried and failed not to think about her outfit and the way it covered just enough to tantalize the mind, but he managed to do his sworn duty regardless.

“Okay,” Nick said, pressing the button. “Execute!”

Amelia immediately started gasping in pain. “Oh, I forgot to mention,” Nick added, “It does hurt. Not much, but the pain’s there.”

“Tell me sooner!” Amelia gasped as her body stretched and shifted. Unlike with Nick, her body and clothes didn’t change at the same time, but instead took their turns. Amelia’s body was changing first, meaning that her already too-small clothes were nearing the breaking point as her body aged to twenty-one years of age.

The sight gave Nick a boner, so he looked away.

Finally, Amelia’s own transformation stopped, and her shredded clothes reformed around her into Terra’s red velvet halter top with matching shoulder-length gloves and a night-blue cape.

“Okay,” Nick said. “Now you want it made permanent, right?”

“Oh yes,” Amelia said. “No way in fucking Hell am I going through that again!”

Nick silently fiddled with the watch, selecting the necessary options to make Amelia’s Terra Transformation permanent. He pressed the Execute button, and… another screen appeared, asking if he wanted to synchronize ages. This apparently would adjust the physical age of Terra to match Amelia’s age.

Nick selected Yes, just as it occurred to him that it should really be Amelia’s decision. “Oops,” Nick said.

“What?” Amelia asked, then winced as she felt her body shrink back down to what Terra apparently looked like at sixteen. Contrary to experience, it didn’t hurt this time.

“I pressed the button to make Terra’s age match yours, and it was your decision.”

“I don’t mind,” Amelia said. “I’m just glad it didn’t hurt.”

“Agreed,” Nick said. “So, what should we do now?”
111111121111211.title: Terra Transformation: Take Two

choices: They go to an amusement park. (And dodge the fees.)
1111111211112111.content:
“Let's go on a date," Amelia suggested.

"A date," Nick noted, turning red again. "Okay, but..."

"I know," Amelia said, just as red. “I’m embarrassed about it myself. But… well, we just fit so well together, you know? Plus we both know each other so well. I’m thinking it’s a waste if we don’t go out at least once.”

“Okay,” Nick said. “So, do you have any clothes in your new size?” Amelia was now at least a full cup size larger, plus slightly taller and far more athletic, not to mention green-haired and curly instead of black and straight. Thankfully Terra’s clothes had shrunk with her, so that Nick wasn’t looking at a beautiful girl whose clothes were too large.

“Not personally,” Amelia said. “But my older sister should have some. Oh, and Nick?”

“Yes?” Nick asked, pretty sure he knew what was coming next.

“Don’t peek,” Amelia responded, with a deadpan look on her face. As predicted by Nick, naturally.

“I won’t,” Nick said.


Amelia came out in a gray T-shirt declaring in black “Stop Looking at my SHIRT!”, a pair of faded blue jeans, and regular sneakers. She looked absolutely beautiful, but also casual and low-maintenance. She had applied light makeup, but truthfully, she didn’t need it a bit. Terra’s face was so beautiful that it would entrance a lesser man with casual eye contact. Like Nick, for instance.

Nick’s reaction was to stare. An angel had descended before him and become his girlfriend.

“Well?” Amelia asked. “Let’s go!”

Nick shook himself. This was no time to be spellbound. “Yeah, let’s go.”

“I hope you aren’t that bad a driver.”

“I what?” Nick asked, stunned. “I don’t have a driver’s license. Not yet, anyway.”

It was Amelia’s turn to stare. “You… you walked here? You didn’t drive?”

“I didn’t do either one,” Nick said honestly. “I used the Teleport spell.”

“Well, I also don’t have a driver’s license,” Amelia said.

“You don’t need one,” Nick pointed out. “You’re Terra.”

Amelia sighed. “Will I have to Teleport both of us?”

“Yup,” Nick said. “The upside is that you get to choose the places we go.”

“All right,” Amelia said, grinning. “Come on over.”

Nick moved so that he and Amelia were standing face-to-face. He grabbed Amelia by the shoulder, sending an electric charge through both of them, and Amelia chanted the spell.

1253321.content:
You receive a package in the mail you take it up to your room, open it to find a portable scanner and instruction book which calls it the disguiseomatic and states that it can turn you it anyone. Naturally, you doubt that it would work but you decide to indulge your curiosity and give it a shot.

As you glance around your room you eventually notice that one of your sister's Sailor Moon DVDs is in your room shrugging your shoulders, you take out the DVD, place it in your PS2, and attach the cord from the watchlike device into the controller slot then hit the button on the watch...nothing happens then as you are about to unhook it

You feel a faint tingling thought your body and as you look down, you notice the device is glowing and hold your wrist up close realizing that something your fingers look more slender, delicate and perfectly manicured?

As you're watching you hand change, numb with shock, you almost don't notice a faint tickling at the back of your neck. Gasping, you finally move your hand to reach for whatever is brushing your neck, and gasp with shock again when you feel silky hair. You pull it in front of your eyes; your still lengthing blonde hair

Now the tingling has become an odd pulling. Muscles all over your body feel like they're contracting, some painfully so. Even the muscles of your face are not exempt. Panicking, you clumsily stumble out of your room and into the adjacent bathroom. As soon as you look in the mirror, you can see your face has already changed. Not just the underlying muscles have changed shaped, but the bone...higher cheekbones, a slimmer jawline. Even your lips look different. Your mouth had been open, agape, but then you close it. Full, kissable lips press together as bright blue eyes stare back at you.

info.brief_description: You find a watch that allows you to transform into fictional girls.
info.description:
Based on Starfighter364’s interactive of the same name.

Your name is Nick. One day, you receive a watch-like device that allows you to obtain the data about fictional girls by scanning a screen or picture, or by plugging a special device that goes in it into a controller slot on a video game console. If you connect the device to the game, then you can enter the game in the body of that character. Eventually, you will gain the abilities to scan the data of female friends and to transform other humans, animals, and dolls/puppets (you won't be able to transform at the time, but you can control them with the device).

Rules:

No gay/lesbian stuff or incest.

Keep any names of characters the same throughout the story.

No killing off Nick or ending the story.

School has just ended for the year.

No turning Nick evil or changing his personality.

Any character that in their series is called a god will be considered a powerful spirit instead in this story, even if the characters from their series won't call them as such.

The watch will prevent Nick from getting a girl pregnant (or from getting pregnant himself) before he is old enough to support a child.

If Nick and someone else who is changed wants to stay that form, then a function will appear on the watch, which will alter reality so that everyone except the two of them believe that the person has always been that way (it can't happen for Nick). If this is done, the original form of the person is lost forever (unless it is a girl who has been scanned by the watch, then her form will be saved in it). Nick will still have control of them, but the watch can be used to transform others again. Nobody will find it odd that the person will be the same as the girl they became. Also, while doing so, Nick can alter the age of the fictional girl to match the age of the person being transformed.

While the watch has Nick (or anyone/anything else that he'd transform) take the form of a character who can transform between girl forms and boy forms will be in girl form the whole time, with no traces of the boy form. While Nick is one of them, he can't go into the series.

If Nick is holding onto someone who is transformed when they go into the series, then he'll go in as well, and be sucked into the body of the main character (or one of them if there are many) regardless of if they or male or female, unless the player is a character in the game, in which case, he'd become that character. If the character is female, then she will be stored on the watch. If not, Nick can transform into that character without the watch. Note: Nick can only become one male per continuity.

If there is ever a debate on the gender of a character, then ask me, and I'll decide. Characters that are considered female:
-Teito Klein from 07 Ghost. He's small and cute, even though he is apparently old enough to be in an army, and his relationship with Mikage and that other guy borders on homo. So I'm making him a girl, just to avoid the identity crisis that 07 Ghost takes in stride.

With the scanning feature, you can use edited versions of characters, including female versions of male characters. If you do this, you must give a link to a picture of that character.

The device is waterproof (along with being indestructible), and can't be taken off once put on. The device also stops him from being able to be possessed, hypnotized, or brainwashed in any way, not that he knows that.

Use proper grammar and spelling.

If I find out that someone who adds has stolen someone else's chapter, and then posted it as their own, then I'll delete it.

Please put up links to pictures of the fictional girls during the option chapters they are mentioned in, or the chapter that Nick turns into them. Don't hesitate to use pictures of what someone as the girl is doing.

There may be other things I'm forgetting, so everything else is fair game unless I remember anything else and add it.

Nick’s personality: Quiet and observant. He doesn’t like to make small talk. However, he is extremely perceptive, as well as being quick-thinking. He will often make observations that surprise people. He’s also a very good liar – he doesn’t keep a poker face, but instead alters his facial expression and body language to broadcast the emotion that he wants to portray. He enjoys video games in general and writing stories. He’s also an anime fan. Incidentally, he knows a lot about psychology. (You can reference the manga Liar Game for ideas.)
Nick’s appearance: Dark hair, somewhat tall. He’s not really what you would call an athlete, but he’s surprisingly good at physical activities. His skin is pale in places and tanned in others, and he doesn’t often show emotion on his face.

Other characters:

Reesa: Nick's little sister, age 13. She's obsessed with the Yu-Gi-Oh! TCG. Unlike other fanatics her age, she's pretty good at playing the game, and is an expert at constructing a good deck. (Nick's opinion is that if she would just focus on school instead of some card game, she could easily skip a grade or five.) She has long brown hair, and is rather tall for a thirteen-year-old kid.

Amelia: If you’re looking for three words to describe Amelia, then those words are “Sarcastic”, “Cynical”, and “Spiteful”. However, Amelia’s prickly exterior hides an inner emotional turmoil, and she remains an enigma to everyone – except Nick, who guessed her emotional state after about an hour in her company. He confronted her with it at the end of the day in a private setting, and she collapsed crying into his arms. Since then, Amelia has had feelings for Nick, and Nick knows it, but he has left the situation alone because he has no experience with love affairs, and doesn’t even know if he returns her feelings. She's sixteen years old. She has long, black hair and an unimpressive figure. She doesn't consciously watch her weight, but she is used to eating diet food. She enjoys RPG video games and watching anime.

Serena: Amelia's older sister, age 21 and with a great figure. More information will be added when someone adds it.

If you create a character, then you must give the details about them, such as their appearance and personality.

You are 16 years old.

Starfighter364's interactive can have a crossover with this one. Neither Nick nor Anthony can transform each other, or anyone that the other already has transformed.

Also, I will give 100 GP to anyone who makes a good chapter, aside from an option chapter, without breaking any of my rules. Furthermore, I will give an extra 500 GP to the first three people for their first good chapters, aside from Starfighter364. I can't afford to pay you right now, but I can and will keep track of how much I owe you.

Finally, have fun!
